name: Chinese New Year Cultural Probe Kit
description:
A cultural probe into the East Asian diasporic experience with celebrating Chinese New Year.


This study is conducted by Som Liengtiraphan for her master's thesis in Integrated Digital Media at NYU. She is investigating how rituals celebrated in Chinese festivals, specifically, Chinese New Year, are passed down from older to younger generations and how these rituals are remembered by young-adult Chinese diaspora community members. Specifically, she wants to learn about the pain points experienced among the younger Chinese diaspora that may be preventing them from celebrating cultural festivals. If you have completed a version, please email/share it with el3429@nyu.edu.
